summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing draft language for a legal filing concerning Jeffrey Epstein's case. It details the roles of Epstein's associates, the accounts of three victims, and the facilitation of abuse through massage appointments. It reveals internal strategy on how to present victim testimony and the non-prosecution agreement considerations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing dozens of minor girls during massage appointments arranged by his staff.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Directed the scheduling of massage appointments alongside Epstein and provided a directory of contacts.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Hired to schedule massage appointments for Epstein, facilitated contact with victims, and later called victims to dissuade them from cooperating with law enforcement.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: Publicly identified victim who reported that Sarah Kellen was present and participated in an instance of abuse.

persons.name: Victim-2
persons.context: Pseudonymous victim pursuing a lawsuit, who reported that Sarah Kellen walked in during an abusive incident.

persons.name: Victim-3
persons.context: Victim whose identity was inadvertently released; reported that Sarah Kellen walked in while she was nude.

connections.description: Worked together to direct Sarah Kellen to schedule massage appointments and maintain a directory of victims.
Epstein hired and directed Kellen to schedule appointments and later to contact victims to dissuade them from cooperating with law enforcement.
Maxwell, alongside Epstein, directed Kellen's work scheduling appointments and provided her with a contact directory.
Kellen scheduled appointments for Victim-1 and was reported to have been present and participated in an instance of abuse.
Kellen scheduled appointments and was reported to have walked in on Victim-2 during an abusive incident.
Kellen scheduled appointments and was reported to have walked in on Victim-3 while she was nude.

events.title: Period of Massage Appointments and Abuse
events.description: Sarah Kellen scheduled hundreds of massage appointments for Epstein, during which he sexually abused dozens of minor victims at his residences in Palm Beach and New York.

events.title: Law Enforcement Investigation Begins
events.description: Sarah Kellen learned law enforcement was investigating Epstein for sex crimes involving minors. At Epstein's direction, she called victims to dissuade them from cooperating.

events.title: Victim Interviews by Federal Agents
events.description: Multiple minor victims were interviewed by federal law enforcement officers as part of the criminal investigation into Epstein and his associates for sex trafficking.

events.title: Prosecution Strategy Discussion
events.description: SDNY prosecutors correspond about draft language for a legal filing, discussing how to present victim accounts and the possibility of a guilty plea.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Sarah Kellen scheduled hundreds of massage appointments for Epstein from 2002-2005, during which he sexually abused dozens of minors aged 14-17.

Three victims reported to law enforcement that Sarah Kellen witnessed or participated in abusive incidents: Victim-1 reported Kellen was present and participated; Victim-2 reported Kellen walked in during oral sex; Victim-3 reported Kellen walked in while she was nude.

In 2005, after learning of the investigation, Kellen at Epstein's direction called multiple minor victims to dissuade them from cooperating with law enforcement, offering legal help and financial incentives.
The document reveals internal prosecution strategy, including a preference to resolve the case via a guilty plea rather than trial, due to victim preferences and the desire to avoid a Fatico hearing.
Victim identities and their preferences are detailed: Victim-1 is publicly identified; Victim-2 uses a pseudonym; Victim-3's identity was inadvertently released and she wishes to remain anonymous.
